that isn't gutsy's fault
When you do bad things in Java, Java slaps your hand

Nope
Stack-smashing/buffer attacks rely on this fact
right, so why doesn't the OS disallow it?
normally you wouldn't program the thing to access memory you havent worked with
this is why you have to be especially careful when reading in data from the user

ok.... so you just do a string comparison

C gives you an argv array and an argc value (length of the argv array)
just run through the argv array and do a string comparison on the thing to see if it is vvf or whatever
